titleStmt.title: Letter, William Randolph Hackley in Memphis, Tenn., to his wife 1865 Feb. 27

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

availability.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

bibl.title: Letter, William Randolph Hackley in Memphis, Tenn., to his wife 1865 Feb. 27

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: Yours of the 19 with Annie's came to hand yesterday I am thankful that you are all well and hope to see you about the Middle of March for a few days. My present occupation gives me a good deal of excercise and as I have been in the office for more than few months is rather tiresome but I will soon get used to it and then it will do me good my health this winter has been excellent I have had but one cold and no affliction of the bowels and all I want is to be with you. I have no time to write more now but will write again soon Tell Annie she may have the books Kisses to all Your Aff husbank WRHackley
